A policeman saw a thief from a distance of 300 meters. As soon as the thief saw the policeman, he started running, and the policeman started chasing him. The thief and the policeman run at speeds of 11 km/h and 13 km/h respectively. After running how many kilometers will the policeman catch the thief?
(1) 1.65
(2) 1.85
(3) 1.75
(4) 1.95
SSC Delhi Police SI, CAPFs SI & CISF ASI (CPO) Exam, 03.10.2023 (Shift-II)
Rima runs 5/4 times faster than Rekha. Seeing this, Rima gives Rekha a head start of 50 meters in a friendly race. Find the distance from the starting point where Rima and Rekha will both meet.

A policeman sees a thief from a distance of 250 meters. When the policeman starts chasing the thief, the thief also starts running. Assume that the speed of the thief is 10 km/h and the speed of the policeman is 12.5 km/h. How far will the thief have run before being caught?

P and Q start traveling from point A to point B at the same time with speeds of 32 km/h and 40 km/h respectively. If P takes 15 minutes more than Q to complete the journey, what is the total distance of the journey from A to B?
Krish takes the same time to run 24 meters as a bus takes to cover a distance of 72 meters. What distance will Krish cover when the bus covers a distance of 4.8 km?
"A car traveling at a constant speed of 50 km/h covers a certain distance in 3 hours. If the speed is only 40 km/h, how much more time will it take to cover the same distance?"

A car travels a distance of x km at a speed of 5 5/9 m/s and returns to the starting point at a speed of 5 m/s. If the total time taken by the car is 7 3/5 hours, then what will be the value of (x + 3)?

"A person, while walking at 3/5 of their usual speed, takes 1 hour and 40 minutes more than the time taken to cover the same distance at their usual speed. How much time will that person take to cover the same distance while walking at their usual speed?"
A person covers a distance of 280 km by motorcycle in 8 hours. If he rides a bicycle and drives it at 3/14 the speed of the motorcycle, then how much distance will he cover in 2 hours?

Both
A person travels 5x distance at a speed of 5 km/h, x distance at a speed of 5 km/h, and 4x distance at a speed of 6 km/h and takes a total of 112 minutes. What is the total distance (in km) traveled by the person?


A takes 3 hours more than B to travel 'd' km. If A doubles their speed, they can cover the same distance in 1 hour less than B. How much time (in hours) does A need to travel 'd' km?
A journey of 900 km is completed in 11 hours. If 2/5th of the journey is completed at a speed of 60 km/h, then at what speed (in km/h) is the remaining journey completed?

Sonal is a cab driver who drives within a city. The distance covered by her on Tuesday (in kilometers) was 12.5% less than the distance covered by her the day before (in kilometers). While the distance covered by her on Wednesday (in kilometers) was 20% more than the distance covered by her on Tuesday (in kilometers). If Sonal covered a total distance of 336 km on Wednesday, then how many kilometers did she cover on Monday?

The distance between two places named A and B is 140 km. Two cars named x and y start simultaneously from A and B respectively. If they travel in the same direction, they meet each other after 7 hours. If they travel towards each other, they meet each other after 1 hour. If the speed of car y is greater than the speed of car x, then what is the speed of car y (in km/h)?
A student goes to school at a speed of 5 1/2 km/h and returns at a speed of 4 km/h. If he takes 4 3/4 hours for the entire journey, then find the total distance covered by the student (in km).

It takes A 2 hours and 30 minutes more than B to cover a distance of 40 km. If A doubles its speed, it can cover the same distance in 1 hour less than B. Find the time (in hours) taken by A to cover a distance of 40 km.
Two cars, A and B, depart from Delhi to Shimla at 8:30 AM and 9:00 AM respectively. They travel at speeds of 40 km/h and 50 km/h respectively. At what distance from Delhi will both cars be together?

The distance from place A to place B is 144 km. Two cars start moving simultaneously, one from A and the other from B. If they move in the same direction, they meet after 12 hours, but if they move towards each other, they meet after 9/8 hours. Find the speed of the faster car (in km/h)."
Two runners run at speeds of 10 meters/minute and 120 meters/minute respectively. If the second runner takes 10 minutes less than the first runner to complete the race, then how long is the race?"

A car travels at a speed of 54 km/h before repair and 72 km/h after repair, respectively. After the repair, it covers a distance of x km in 6 hours. How much time (in hours) will it take to cover a distance of 5x km before the car repair?

Alok travels from P to Q at a speed of 6 km/h. At the same time, Raman travels from place P to Q at a speed of 9 km/h. Raman reaches Q and returns towards P. He meets Alok at place R. If the length of PQ is 15 km, what is the length of PR?

A and B started their journey from X to Y and Y to X respectively. After crossing each other, A and B complete their remaining journey in 6 1/8 hours and 8 hours respectively. If the speed of B is 28 km/h, then the speed of A (in km/h) is:

A person travels at a speed of 60 km/h and reaches their destination in a fixed time. They cover 60% of their journey in 2/5 of the time. At what speed (in km/h) should they travel to complete the remaining journey so that they reach their destination on time?

"A takes 30 minutes more than B to cover a distance of 15 km at a certain speed. However, if A doubles their speed, they take one hour less than B to cover the same distance. What is the speed of B (in km/h)?

Two motorcyclists A and B start moving towards each other simultaneously at speeds of 75 km/h and 60 km/h respectively. They meet each other after 20 minutes. What was the distance (in km) between them when they started moving?

If each customer is now paying ‚Çπ20 for 1 kg, how much money were they paying for the same quantity of goods before the raid? (Rounded to two decimal places)

14 Question END

B bought 15 kg of apples from a wholesaler at the rate of ‚Çπ180 per kg, who uses a weight of 950 grams for a kg. B sold all these apples at the rate of ‚Çπ180 per kg, but used a weight of 750 grams for a kg in the transaction. Find the profit percentage earned by B in this transaction (correct to two decimal places).

A vegetable vendor's 2 kilogram weight is 100 grams less than the actual weight. The vendor sold 2 kilograms of potatoes to a customer for ‚Çπ44 using the same weight. The vendor had bought potatoes at the rate of ‚Çπ18 per kilogram. What was his profit on selling the potatoes?
A shopkeeper claims that he is selling sugar at ‚Çπ27/kg, which costs him ‚Çπ30/kg, but he gives 750 grams instead of 1000 grams. Find his profit or loss percentage

Sudhir claimed to sell his goods at only 8% above the production cost, but used a weight labeled 750 grams, while its actual weight was 720 grams. What was the actual profit percentage earned by Sudhir?

"A dishonest merchant is selling sugar at ‚Çπ40 per kg and pretending that he is selling it at a loss of ‚Çπ5 per kg, but he is actually manipulating the weight and weighing 800 grams instead of 1 kg. Find his actual profit or loss percentage?
